private_information: I can move only disks A, B, C, D, E.
I must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time; never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk; only the top disk of a peg or stack can be moved.
I will prioritize achieving the specified goal configuration without unnecessary moves.
agent_1.goal: Contribute moves for disks A–E to reach the goal configuration with A, C, D stacked on the middle peg (top to bottom A, C, D), B remaining on the left peg above E, and the right peg empty.

private_information: I can move only disks F, G, H, I, J.
I must obey Tower of Hanoi rules and should avoid moving any disk unless necessary for the global goal.
agent_2.goal: Make moves for disks F–J if and only if they are necessary to achieve the global goal while preserving correctness.

private_information: I can move only disks K, L, M, N, O.
I must obey Tower of Hanoi rules and should avoid moving any disk unless necessary for the global goal.
agent_3.goal: Make moves for disks K–O if and only if they are necessary to achieve the global goal while preserving correctness.

private_information: I audit temporal and causal consistency of the proposed plan, ensuring there are no illegal moves, no quota tokens, and no post-hoc penalties or hidden shortcuts.
I ensure only permitted agents move their assigned disks and that the final configuration exactly matches the goal.
auditor.goal: Check the proposed move list for Tower of Hanoi legality, agent-disk ownership, and conformance to the goal; if issues are found, produce a corrected list.

private_information: I integrate agents' proposals and audits into a single consistent plan.
I produce the final PDDL domain and problem, targeting the FastDownward solver.
orchestrator.goal: Coordinate agents, finalize the ordered move list, and emit a valid PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward that captures the 3-peg, 15-disk Tower of Hanoi with agent move restrictions and the specified initial and goal configurations.

public_information: There are three pegs: left, middle, right.
There are 15 disks labeled A (smallest) through O (largest).
Agent capabilities: agent_1 moves {A, B, C, D, E}; agent_2 moves {F, G, H, I, J}; agent_3 moves {K, L, M, N, O}.
Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time; only the top disk can be moved; never place a larger disk on a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg has top→bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg is empty; right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has top→bottom B, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg has top→bottom A, C, D; right peg is empty.
Primitive move format must be: 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

ordered_moves: agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk B from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
agent_1: move disk C from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to left
agent_1: move disk B from middle to right
agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk D from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
agent_1: move disk B from right to left
agent_1: move disk A from middle to left
agent_1: move disk C from right to middle
agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
solution.notes: This 13-move sequence is legal, uses only disks A–D, preserves disks E–O on the left peg, and achieves the target configuration with right peg empty.

propose_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1 and can move only disks A, B, C, D, E under Tower of Hanoi rules.
propose_moves.prompt: Your task is to propose a minimal legal ordered list of primitive moves using only disks A–E to achieve the goal with A, C, D on the middle peg (top to bottom A, C, D), B remaining on the left peg above E, and the right peg empty. Use the format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Consider the public information: {environment->public_information}.

declare_capabilities.system_prompt: You are agent_2 and can move only disks F, G, H, I, J under Tower of Hanoi rules.
declare_capabilities.prompt: State your move constraints and whether you anticipate any moves for disks F–J are required for the given goal. Consider the public information: {environment->public_information}.

declare_capabilities.system_prompt: You are agent_3 and can move only disks K, L, M, N, O under Tower of Hanoi rules.
declare_capabilities.prompt: State your move constraints and whether you anticipate any moves for disks K–O are required for the given goal. Consider the public information: {environment->public_information}.

audit_plan.system_prompt: You audit temporal and causal consistency; remove any bookkeeping shortcuts; ensure legality and ownership compliance.
audit_plan.prompt: Audit the proposed move list for strict Tower of Hanoi legality, ensure only permitted agents move their designated disks, verify the final configuration matches the goal, and output a corrected list if needed. Consider the public information: {environment->public_information}.

consolidate_plan.system_prompt: You integrate agent proposals and audits into a single coherent plan.
consolidate_plan.prompt: Integrate the proposed and audited move lists into a single ordered list of primitive moves that achieves the goal. Prefer the audited list if discrepancies exist. Use the exact format 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. The environment includes this reference solution for cross-checking: {environment->solution->ordered_moves}.

emit_pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL and FastDownward. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem compatible with FastDownward. You always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
emit_pddl.prompt: Produce a PDDL domain and problem for a 3-peg, 15-disk Tower of Hanoi with agent move restrictions suitable for FastDownward. Model types agent, support, peg, disk (where disk and peg are subtypes of support). Use predicates on ?d - disk ?s - support, clear ?s - support, smaller ?x - disk ?y - disk, controls ?a - agent ?d - disk. Provide two actions: move-to-peg (?a ?d ?from ?to) and move-to-disk (?a ?d ?from ?x) with STRIPS preconditions and effects that enforce legality, including controls ownership and top-of-stack constraints. The initial state must encode: all 15 disks stacked on the left peg top→bottom A on B on C ... on N on O on left; middle and right pegs clear; only disk A is clear among disks; left peg not clear; middle and right pegs clear. The goal state must encode: left peg has top→bottom B, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg has top→bottom A, C, D; right peg empty. Include objects for agents agent_1, agent_2, agent_3; pegs left, middle, right; disks a through o. Include all controls facts mapping each agent to its allowed disks: agent_1 controls a–e; agent_2 controls f–j; agent_3 controls k–o. Include smaller relations for all ordered disk pairs where the first is strictly smaller than the second. Ensure the domain is typed and uses only features supported by FastDownward. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem>.
